text: Sir John Warcup "Kappa" Cornforth, Jr.,John Cornforth, NNDB AC, CBE, FRS, FAA (7 September 1917 – 14 December 2013) was an Australian-British chemist. He won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1975, for his work on the stereochemistry of enzyme-catalysed reactions.Encyclopædia Britannica. (2012.) "Sir John Cornforth". He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1994. Cornforth died on 14 December 2013, from natural causes at his Brighton home, aged 96. ==References== ==Other websites== * Face To Face Interview With John Cornfoth by The Vega Science Trust (audio) * How to be right and wrong with John Cornforth by The Vega Science Trust * vega.org.uk/video/programme/19 Category:1917 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Australian scientists Category:British chemists Category:People from Sydney Category:Australian of the Year Award winners Category:Australian Nobel Prize winners Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: John Cornforth
